org.jpws.front

Interface MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile

  • Enclosing class:
    MirrorFileManager

    public static interface MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Method Detail

      • getFilePath

        java.lang.String getFilePath()
        Returns a string that identifies the mirrorable source file in the application system in a way that is stable over different sessions of the user program. In the regular case the absolute file path of the source file is sufficient. If different media channels are used, a likewise stable identifier of the channel can be added to the identifier.
        Returns:
        String unfailable file identifier

      • getModifyNumber

        int getModifyNumber()
        Returns the number associated with this file which marks its latest modified state. All modification steps performed on the mirrorable file should result in increment of this number.
        Returns:
        int modify number

      • getMirrorableClone

        MirrorFileManager.MirrorableFile getMirrorableClone()
        Returns a MirrorableFile object which represents a data clone of the source file. If this method returns not null the mirror manager will perform IO activity in relation to this mirror file through calling the clone instead of the original. (This is handy if the clone is created much quicker than the mirror file can be written, and if enough space can be assumed available in VM. IO to the mirror file is always done in a background thread, but working on the clone will not block other work on the original by synchronisation blocks.)

        Note: Only method mirrorWrite() will ever be called from the manager on the clone.

        Returns:
        MirrorableFile "snapshot" clone or null
        See Also:
        mirrorWrite()

      • mirrorWrite

        void mirrorWrite(java.io.OutputStream out)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Performs output of a persistent state of the mirrorable file to the mirror. The implementing class must ensure that during performance of this routine no other thread can modify the relevant data content of this file.
        Parameters:
        out - OutputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • mirrorDetected

        void mirrorDetected(java.io.File mirror)
        This method is called by the manager in response to addMirrorable() indicating that a mirror file for the added source file has been found. The mirror file is indicated with the parameter.
        Parameters:
        mirror - File mirror file of this source file
